results.title: Flight into yesterday
results.creator_credit: Ivern Hendrickson, Frank Burgess and Department of Civil Aviation, Australia
results.brief_description: History of commercial aviation in Papua-New Guinea from the pioneering airfreight flights to the mountain goldfields to the present services. Narrated by Jim Berinson.

results.title: Flight in white
results.creator_credit: William Canning and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Nothing a man does on his own brings him closer to flight than skiing, a sport for which Canada provides the ultimate facilities. Filmed in 1968 in Banff and Jasper National Parks in the famed Canadian Rockies, where the alpine scenery of winter is no less spectacular than that of summer, this picture reveals the fine blend of exhilaration, risk, physical prowess and, of course, speed, that are all part of this challenging sport. Film without words.

results.title: Flight: an anthology
results.brief_description: An anthology of verse, prose, music and film about flying. In an age of technicalities and super-sonic developments, the film recaptures the basic freedom of getting above the clouds.

results.title: Flax
results.brief_description: Opens with scenes of the flax industry in pre-war Ireland. With the outbreak of war, Britain’s supply of European flax was cut off. The film shows various improvements adopted to increase the production of flax in Britain, including the use of machines to pull the fibre and also the use of material in the unretted state.

results.title: Flashpoint
results.creator_credit: Ernie Schmidt, Don Worobey and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated interpretation of the Pacific Ocean ablaze as a result of a collision between two giant supertankers. The film explains that there is no technology available to cope with such a disaster, and in a realistic, animated way it is a reminder of the dangers of tanker traffic in coastal waters. The stunning animation method used in this short film is similar to Japanese ‘Manga’ style. Although this film deals with serious issues surrounding environmental disasters, it manages to introduce some comic moments that simultaneously educate and entertain. Story by Ian Slater. Animation by Ernie Schmidt.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ernie Schmidt, Don Worobey and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Flash point
results.creator_credit: Brian Hannant, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description: A drama set in the remote outback northwestern mining town of Mount Newman where men outnumber women fifty to one. Provides a study of mateship, of human relationships against the background of Australia’s mineral development. An interesting study of the tensions, and the loneliness that exists in such a remote mining town.

results.title: Flare of the sun
results.brief_description: New Zealand’s contribution to the International Geophysical Year, 1957-1958, as exemplified in the tracking of sunspots and the consequent interruptions to radio signals. The extent of New Zealand’s observations; routine work at stations from Antarctica to the Pacific; the elaborate international communications system for tracing a sunspot and warning radio channels. A picture of scientific cooperation on an international scale.

results.title: Flare: a ski trip
results.creator_credit: Sam Neill, Tom Williamson and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: A team of six skiers returning to New Zealand demonstrate freestyle skiing. The three basic Freestyle skills; Ballet, Jumping and Moguls or Bumps are shown in North and South Island Skifields. The film culminates in a skier’s dream - to ski the untracked slopes of a live volcano.

results.title: The Flame that freezes
results.brief_description: The manufacture of Electrolux absorption-type refrigerators in the company’s Melbourne factory. Compares old methods of food preservation with those using refrigeration principles. Shows the manufacture of the freezing unit and explains how it operates. Diagrams explain the operation of refrigerators using gas, kerosene and electricity. Summarises the uses of refrigeration in medical services in both city and country.
